Gredy Hyena 
 John Nga'sike 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Atabo and Akiru went to 
 
 colect water at the river. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 On their way back home 
 
 they rested on a big rock. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Atabo tried to stand up to 
 
 continue home but was 
 
 stuck to the rock. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Akiru ran home to cal 
 
 mother. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When mother arived at the 
 
 rock, she found Atabo truly 
 
 stuck. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “I wil make a fence around 
 
 the rock to protect you 
 
 from wild animals,” mother 
 
 said to Atabo. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 So, she made a fence with 
 
 only one dor which she 
 
 used to get inside. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Then mother said to Atabo, “When I come to fed 
 
 you I wil sing a song for you to open the dor.” 
 
 This is the song she sang: 
 
 “lka koku nachirima, 
 
 Bala ekena, 
 
 Ke.ke.i.ya. 
 
 Tangarae totokonia kainak ngakon kile.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 And mother also said, “Never open the dor to a 
 
 stranger.” 
 
 
 
 So whenever mother came she sang the song, the 
 
 dor opened and she gave Atabo fod. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 But Hyena was hiding and 
 
 watching and listening 
 
 when mother came to fed 
 
 Atabo. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Hyena tried to copy the 
 
 song. He practised and 
 
 practised. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The other animals told 
 
 Hyena to swalow a fly 
 
 from the river so that he 
 
 could sing beter. 
 
 
 
 He swalowed a fly from 
 
 the river and he came to 
 
 sing. But the dor did not 
 
 
 open. 
 
 
 
 
 
 12  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 He swalowed a fly from 
 
 the plains and he came to 
 
 sing. But the dor did not 
 
 open. 
 
 
 
 Finaly he swalowed a fly 
 
 from the far away plains. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 13  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 He came to sing, and the 
 
 dor opened. 
 
 
 
 Hyena ate Atabo. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 14  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When mother came again, 
 
 she sang, and sang, and 
 
 sang. But nothing 
 
 hapened. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 15  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Mother caled a meting of 
 
 al the animals and lit a 
 
 very big fire. 
 
 
 
 “The animal that ate Atabo 
 
 wil fal into the fire and 
 
 burn,” she said. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 16  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Al the animals jumped 
 
 safely over the fire until the 
 
 fox had a turn. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 17  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Fox jumped and the fire 
 
 caught his tail. 
 
 
 
 He cried in pain. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 18  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Last of al came the hyena. 
 
 
 
 He jumped and fel in the 
 
 fire. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 19  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Then the animals sang 
 
 another song: 
 
 
 
 “Ata kalio, 
 
 Anikanyamit ikon koku, 
 
 Achakakin nakim na, 
 
 Chi.gi.gir.”
